org.zoolu.util

Class LoggerWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.zoolu.util.LoggerWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Logger

    public class LoggerWriter
extends java.lang.Object
implements Logger
    Simple logger that writes log messages onto a logfile, or standard output, or Writer, or OutputStream or PrintStream.

    When creating a logger you can also specify a priority_level and a maximum_size for the log.

    The attribute priority_level is used to manage different levels of verboseness. When adding a log message through the method log(LoggerLevel, Class, String) a LoggerLevel log_level for the given message is specified; only log messages with a log_level greater or equal to the logger priority_level are recorded.
    With priority level LoggerLevel.OFF no messages are logged. With priority level LoggerLevel.ALL all messages are logged.

    The attribute maximum_size is used to limit the size the log. When the log size reaches the maximum_size value, no more log messages are recorded.

        public LoggerWriter(java.lang.String file_name,
                    LoggerLevel logging_level,

      • LoggerWriter

        public LoggerWriter(java.lang.String file_name,
                    LoggerLevel logging_level,
                    long max_size,
                    boolean append)
        Creates a new the LoggerWriter.
        Parameters:
        file_name - the file where log messages are written to
        logging_level - the logging level
        max_size - the maximum size for the log file, that is the maximum number of characters that can be wirtten
        append - if true, the file is opened in 'append' mode, that is the new messages are appended to the previously saved file (the file is not rewritten)
